channel.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
channel.description:
I bought a Logitech Illuminated Keyboard (model 920-something-something-something; it's not exactly clear) to use with my new desktop. I've discovered recently that on this model of keyboard, Shift+W+Space can't all be held at once. So, no jumping while sprinting; kind of a big deal. I'm going to return this keyboard, and I was wondering whether the forumites here had any recommendations for a better one. I'm looking for a low-profile keyboard, similar to a laptop keyboard or (shudder) a standard Apple keyboard. I use the Apple keyboard at work, and I actually really like the feel of it. Illuminated keys are a plus, but not necessary. Also, price is not necessarily an obstacle. Lob out your suggestions and I'll decide later whether the price is going to be prohibitive.
Thanks all.

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Scrab_on_mars
item.description:
Just don’t buy a Logitech Gaming Keyboard. I have one and it ghosts like hell.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
acade365:

are you sure about this? I’ve been thinking about getting a new cheap board for a while and this would convince me to get the K200.

Yes. Yes I am. I was playing deus Ex today and I was running with ‘w’, sprinting with ‘shift’ and then jumping at the same time with ‘space’.

But if the microsoft keyboards don’t have this issue, I’d be half tempted to get one of the 4000’s, the ergonomic one.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Vitriol
item.description:
I’ve also got a Sidewinder X6 (and an X5 mouse to match) and can vouch for it. Looks great, keys feel great, doesn’t have the shift+w+space problem and can be made compact by removing the keypad (just pulls off the side).

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Scrue
item.description:
I got this sidewinder x4 yesterday and it’s the best keyboard I’ve ever used.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Jim_DiGriz
item.description:
I have the MS Sidewinder X6 and a Logitech G15. Both are nice, but the Sidewinder has a removable keypad, the keypad can be placed on either the left or right sides, and it locks in place magnetically. It also has knobs for volume and LED brightness, plus a bunch of programmable keys, and macro support. I also like the feel of the keys on the Sidewinder slightly better.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Huh, that looks like the same board. Well, it’s cool that yours actually works, then.

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Do you have this keyboard? If you read the one- and two-egg reviews on that page, a great many of them complain about anti-ghosting problems, with many of them specifically mentioning the the Shift+W+Space combination. Again, something I wish I’d seen before I bought the board in the first place. But anyway, I ended up going with the i-rocks board I linked earlier in the thread. It came yesterday and I’m loving it so far; feels just like the Apple board I have at work, with no wonky anti-ghosting issues. Sent this sub-par Logitech board packing back off to Amazon today. Thanks for all your suggestions.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
I’m currently using this MS keyboard.

After binding Shift to crouch I can proudly assure you that Shift + W + Spacebar fully works. I’m pretty sure the cheaper wired models around $10 US will work too, because I’ve owned a few of them and to my recollection I’ve never had a problem in-game.

Read full topic

I have the logitech G19 and its awesome. The screen is a bit of a gimmick though, so i’d go with the G110 is it? The updated G11 that has no screen. They are nice man.

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Bad_D0g
item.description:
My Logitech G110 works great, the keys feel real nice. It’s really just a G15 without the stupidly expensive LCD screen, you can probably grab one for under $70 now. It doesn’t really feel like one of those overkill gaming keyboards, but it doesn’t feel cheap either

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I hadn’t bothered to test it out on my keyboard, but apparently the Cyborg V5 doesn’t let you push Shift + W + Spacebar either. I know you’re not considering it though, geek.

It’s not a huge deal I guess. Not until I go to play HL2 again, anyway :fffuuu:

Edit: the game I tested it on didn’t like the key combo. I tried it later when I was playing Oblivion, and it worked fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend Me a Keyboard
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Well if you’re not looking for fancy, the one I have is nice. Logitech cheap-ass keyboard, but the multiple keys thing works, it has media player controls you can use from ingame, it’s not dampened so it can clack a bit, but it was the cheapest one I could find

one second link. If you can’t get it anymore, i guess equivalent model

EDIT: https://www.logitech.com/en-gb/keyboards/keyboard/devices/7241
I realise now it’s not illuminated, which may bother some, but it’s okay for me.

Read full topic
